member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.AAPT.AAPT
member.summary:
.NET 4.x wrapper class, to interact with the (A)ndroid (A)sset (P)ackaging (T)ool.
*NOTE* ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
*NOTE* Exceptions are nested commands, these u have to quote ur self.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.AAPT.AAPT.Dispose
member.summary:
Dispose is not a real IDisposable but it do its work.
It will reset the whole AAPT class to null, everything in this class will be deleted, stopped, closed, etc...

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.AAPT.AAPT.Xecute(System.String,System.Int32)
member.param: Defines the time in ms Xecute will wait before it closes the process, -1 implies infinite.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.AAPT.AAPT.Execute(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Execute custom AAPT command
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite.
member.param: time the process will wait for output, -1 implies infinite, 0 implies class internal timeout

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.AAPT.AAPT.CmdTimeOut
member.summary:
CMDTimeOut define for the whole instance how long Xecute() will wait for the given process to responde.
*NOTE* Instance default is "-1", it implies infinite.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB
member.summary:
.NET 4.x wrapper class, to interact with an Android device via the (A)ndroid (D)ebug (B)ridge.
*NOTE* ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
*NOTE* Exceptions are nested commands, these u have to quote ur self.
*NOTE* All functions in this and some sub-classes are designed to work primary without root.
*NOTE* If u want to use all functions with root rights, u have to restart the ADB Deamon on the device with root rights.
*NOTE* U can do so by using Instance().Device.Deamon.Root() or simply Instance().Root().

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB.Instance(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns and if not exists creates, the choosen ADB device instance
*NOTE* This is the basic interactor in this class, via this var u MUST get/create every device instance.
*NOTE* Via device u can get/create the device specific instance. If device is empty, the return is ever the class selected device.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB.Instance(AndroidCtrl.DataModelDevicesItem)
member.summary:
Returns and if not exists creates, the choosen ADB device instance
*NOTE* This is the basic interactor in this class, via this var u MUST get/create every device instance.
*NOTE* Via device u can get/create the device specific instance. If device is null, the return is ever the class selected device.

member.summary: Remove the given device from the instance dictionary.

member.summary:

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB.ShellCmdStack(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Send an Shell-Command-Stack to the Device
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite. timeOut = 0 use the instance default timeout.
*NOTE* Between the cmds in the stack is an delay of 150 ms
*HINT* If u want to send a SU-Command-Stack use Device.SU.ShellCmdStack()
member.param: Command to send to Device Shell
time the process will wait for output, -1 implies infinite, 0 implies class internal timeout. timeOut = 0 use the instance default timeout.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Directories.Chmod(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the given chmod for this directory on the device.
*NOTE* U can also set an unix chmod (rwxrwxrwx). If u want to set an unix format u must use the full 9 chars.
*NOTE* Like this examples: (rw-rwx-wt), (rwsrwsrwt), (rw-r--r--)
*HINT* Usefull if u use the directory parser and want to copy some permissions to other files/folders.
*HINT* This function uses Tools.General.ConvertUnixChmod() to convert the unix format to an number.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Su.ShellCmd(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Send an SU-Shell-Command to the Device
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite. timeOut = 0 use the instance default timeout.
*NOTE* This function needs root access on the device

time the process will wait for output, -1 implies infinite, 0 implies class internal timeout. timeOut = 0 use the instance default timeout.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Su.ShellCmdStack(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Send an SU-Shell-Command-Stack to the Device
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite. timeOut = 0 use the instance default timeout.
*NOTE* Between the cmds in the stack is an delay of 150 ms
*NOTE* This function needs root access on the device
member.param: Command to send to Device Shell
time the process will wait for output, -1 implies infinite, 0 implies class internal timeout. timeOut = 0 use the instance default timeout.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Su.Version
member.summary:
Version return the current SU version number
*NOTE* if the version can not be determined or if su is not found or not accessable the return is String.Empty

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.PushPullUTF8
member.summary:
PushPullUTF8 is an ADB push/pull UTF-8 wrapper.
U've never seen this before, with this extreme powerfull wrapper class, u can transfer UTF-8 encoded file/folder names to/from ur device
with the correct names after the copy process. So u'll never again have problems with files/folders names/paths which contains for example ( etc.).

Device path MUST BE A FOLDER, remember use "/" instead of "\" or "\\"

ShellRT starts an ADB shell process in an background thread and return its output via its CallbackProcessOutput delegate, u have also the ablility to send commands to the running shell via RunCMD("my command") function.
*NOTE* Between the cmds is an delay of 150 ms

member.summary:
Executes a single AAPT command in an hidden process window and wait the given time (ms) for output before it ends.
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite.
member.param: Defines the time in ms the process will wait before it closes if no output returs, -1 implies infinite.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ProcessModels.General.ExecuteBGADB(AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Executes a single ADB command in an hidden process window and wait the given time (ms) for output before it ends.
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite.
member.param: Defines the time in ms the process will wait before it closes if no output returs, -1 implies infinite.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ProcessModels.General.ExecuteBGADBStack(AndroidCtrl.ADB.ADB,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Executes a stack of ADB commands in an hidden process window and wait the given time (ms) for output before it ends.
*NOTE* This is only usefull if u want to send a stack of shell/emu commands.
*NOTE* If u want to send different ADB commands u need to use ExecuteBGStack() like, ExecuteBGStack("cmd.exe", "", ADBCommandStack, timeout)
*NOTE* Between the cmds in the stack is an delay of 150 ms
*NOTE* timeOut = -1 implies infinite.
member.param: Defines the time in ms the process will wait before it closes if no output returs, -1 implies infinite.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.Signer.Signer
member.summary:
.NET 4.x wrapper class, to interact with the Signapk.jar.
*NOTE* ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
*NOTE* Exceptions are nested commands, these u have to quote ur self.
*NOTE* Until JavaExists() returns false, all calls inside this class and all subclasses will not work!
*NOTE* If u call any method until JavaExists() returns false, u'll get no exceptions! Coz, ExecuteBG() checks if the given
*NOTE* (.exe) file exists, if not, it will return an empty List string. So if the (.exe) not exists no call will be executed!

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.Signer.Signer.Dispose
member.summary:
Dispose is not a real IDisposable but it do its work.
It will reset the whole Signer class to null, everything in this class will be deleted, stopped, closed, etc...
